sentence.Network_en: Your non-conformist ways will probably get you into trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 你特立独行的行事方式可能会给自己惹来麻烦。

sentence.Network_en: Victoria stood out as a dazzling non-conformist.
sentence.Network_cn: 维多利亚以令人惊叹的打破陈规者的形象而引人注目。

sentence.Network_en: Mr Gordon now feels forced into an ever more conformist way of running his practice.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在，戈登先生觉得被迫以一种更为守旧的方式经营自己的业务。

entry.tran: 墨守成规的;循规蹈矩的
entry.def: Someone who is conformist behaves or thinks like everyone else rather than doing things that are original.

example.ex: He may have to become more conformist if he is to prosper again...
example.tran: 要想再现辉煌，他可能得更多地依照习惯办事。

example.ex: Mr Gordon now feels forced into an ever more conformist way of running his practice.
example.tran: 现在，戈登先生觉得被迫以一种更为守旧的方式经营自己的业务。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who conforms to established standards of conduct (especially in religious matters)
1. marked by conformity or convention; not corresponding to current customs or rules or styles;

sentences.sentence: "underneath the radical image teenagers are surprisingly conformist"

means.word_mean: 2. adhering to established customs or doctrines (especially in religion)
